case_vignette: AN OTHERWISE HEALTHY 60-YEAR-OLD DISHWASHER PRESENTS WITH ASYMPTOMATIC GREEN DISCOLORATION OF HIS RIGHT MIDDLE FINGERNAIL OVER A PERIOD OF 2 MONTHS. THE DISCOLORATION BEGAN FROM THE DISTAL MARGIN. HE DENIES WEARING GLOVES WHILE WORKING AND REPORTS A TENDENCY TO PICK AT HIS NAILS WHEN NERVOUS. ON EXAMINATION, DISTAL ONYCHOLYSIS AND GREEN DISCOLORATION ARE PRESENT EXCLUSIVELY ON THE RIGHT MIDDLE NAIL PLATE STARTING FROM THE DISTAL EDGE WITHOUT SIGNS OF PARONYCHIA. DERMOSCOPY REVEALS PIGMENT LOCALIZATION UNDER THE NAIL PLATE.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a green discoloration on my right middle fingernail.
Has there been any trauma or injury to that nail?
No, there hasn't been any trauma or injury to the nail.
Is the nail painful or do you see any discharge?
No, the nail isn't painful and there's no discharge.
Have you noticed any changes in the shape or thickness of your nail?
No, there haven't been any changes in the shape or thickness of my nail.
Do you have a history of any chronic health conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I do not have any chronic health conditions and I'm not taking any medications.
Do you frequently have your hands in water or exposed to moist environments?
Yes, I frequently have my hands in water because I work as a dishwasher and I don't wear gloves while working.
**Final Diagnosis:** Green nail syndrome (Chloronychia)

The patient does not have any chronic health conditions and is not taking any medications. The patient often has their hands in water due to their occupation as a dishwasher and does not wear gloves while working.
